intro: Byrsonima hypoleuca, commonly known as the white soursop or Brazilian star-apple, is a small evergreen tree native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its thick, leathery leaves and showy, fragrant white flowers. The fruit is a large, spiny capsule that matures to a yellow or orange color, containing a single large, soft, white, seedless pulp. The plant is adapted to grow in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in humid climates. It is valued not only for its edible fruit but also for its ornamental qualities and traditional medicinal uses.
